member.name: IWriteEngine2.CancelWrite
member.summary: Cancels a write operation that is in progress.

returns.para: The following values are returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation: The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The 'write' operation initiated by the last call to has not yet begun, and cannot be canceled. It is recommended to call until a different success code is returned.
Value: 0x00AA0302L

returns.para: The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IWriteEngine2.get_BytesPerSector
member.summary: Retrieves the number of bytes to use for each sector during writing. The returned value indicates what the value previously set with , and does not return a current bytes per sector value for media.

param.name: value
param.para: Number of bytes to use for each sector during writing.
param.div: Note If has not been called, this parameter will indicate a value of '-1'.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IWriteEngine2.get_EndingSectorsPerSecond
member.summary: Retrieves the estimated number of sectors per second that the recording device can write to the media at the end of the writing process.

param.name: value
param.para: Approximate number of sectors per second that the recording device can write to the media at the end of the writing process.
A value of -1 indicates maximum speed.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IWriteEngine2.get_Recorder
member.summary: Retrieves the recording device to use in the write operation.
member.param: An interface that identifies the recording device to use in the write operation.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IWriteEngine2.get_StartingSectorsPerSecond
member.summary: Retrieves the estimated number of sectors per second that the recording device can write to the media at the start of the writing process.

param.name: value
param.para: Approximate number of sectors per second that the recording device can write to the media at the start of the writing process.
A value of -1 indicates maximum speed.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IWriteEngine2.get_UseStreamingWrite12
member.summary: Retrieves a value that indicates if the write operations use the WRITE12 or WRITE10 command.
member.param: If VARIANT_TRUE, the write operations use the WRITE12 command with the streaming bit set to one. Otherwise, if VARIANT_FALSE, the write operations use the WRITE10 command.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IWriteEngine2.get_WriteInProgress
member.summary: Retrieves a value that indicates whether the recorder is currently writing data to the disc.
member.param: If VARIANT_TRUE, the recorder is currently writing data to the disc. Otherwise, if VARIANT_FALSE, the recorder is not currently writing to disc.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IWriteEngine2.put_BytesPerSector
member.summary: Sets the number of bytes to use for each sector during writing.
member.param: Number of bytes to use for each sector during writing. The minimum size is 1 byte and the maximum is MAXLONG bytes. Typically, this value is 2,048 bytes for CD media, although any arbitrary size is supported (such as 2352 or 2448). This value is limited to the , which is typically 65,536 (64K) bytes.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

member.name: IWriteEngine2.put_EndingSectorsPerSecond
member.summary: Sets the estimated number of sectors per second that the recording device can write to the media at the end of the writing process.
member.param: Approximate number of sectors per second that the recording device can write to the media at the end of the writing process. The default is -1 for maximum speed.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

member.name: IWriteEngine2.put_Recorder
member.summary: Sets a recording device for the write operation.
member.param: An interface that identifies the recording device to use in the write operation.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.name: IWriteEngine2.put_StartingSectorsPerSecond
member.summary: Sets the estimated number of sectors per second that the recording device can write to the media at the start of the writing process.
member.param: Approximate number of sectors per second that the recording device can write to the media at the start of the writing process. The default is -1 for maximum speed.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

member.name: IWriteEngine2.put_UseStreamingWrite12
member.summary: Sets a value that indicates if the write operations use the WRITE12 or WRITE10 command.
member.param: Set to VARIANT_TRUE to use the WRITE12 command with the streaming bit set to one when writing to disc. Otherwise, set VARIANT_FALSE to use the WRITE10 command. The default is VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
Setting this property to VARIANT_TRUE is currently not supported.
Value: 0x80004001

member.name: IWriteEngine2.WriteSection
member.summary: Writes a data stream to the current recorder.
member.param: An IStream interface of the data stream to write to the recorder.
Starting logical block address (LBA) of the write operation. Negative values are supported.
Number of blocks from the data stream to write.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057
